Reviews.Title: Excellent value and price.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Baughman
Reviews.Content: I got this phone and net10 pre-paid service because I was paying over $50 a month with AT&T;'s cheapest plan and was only using 100 minutes a month and a handful of texts. This is a great basic phone strictly for making calls and texts. It doesn't come with any minutes (except 10 bonus minutes for activation) but you can buy these cards pretty much anywhere that sells prepaid cards. The minutes are THE cheapest of any prepaid service and your minutes roll over each month. AWESOME! The phone doesn't look cheap at all. It is shiny, sleek and modern looking. The best deal on cards is the 300 minutes for $30 and 60 days of service. Thats $15 a month. Texts only use half a minute of time! One of the best things is that Net10 uses the AT&T; network so you are covered everywhere and they don't charge roaming charges! If you are thinking of getting pre-paid service go with Net10, it is the best hands down!

Reviews.Title: Great phone for what it is...
Reviews.Author: Isabelle Belzile
Reviews.Content: I got this phone as a temporary substitute after my Blackberry died, and I couldn't find any of my old cell phones. For $15 retail it's great for what it is: a cheap, no contract, disposable phone. No fanciness here to distract you. No pesky camera or Bluetooth or web access to trick you into thinking it's somehow high end. It does phone calls and text messages, and not much of anything else. Ok that's not quite true. It has a tip calculator, a regular calculator, alarm clock, stopwatch, unit convertor (miles to kilometers, feet to meters, etc) and (wait for it) sudoku and Battle Reversi. In all it's very reminiscent of cell phones, circa 2003 or so. Battery life is utterly phenomenal though. I've carried the phone around all day, making a number of phone calls, and the phone was not only still alive, but instructed me to disconnect the charger almost immediately as the battery was full. Quite a contrast to modern smartphones. The charger is standard micro USB and interchangeable with most other new phones. Net10's actual phone service is a function of the networks they piggyback on, AT&T; and T-Mobile in the case of this phone. I activated the phone on Net10's website, thus avoiding dealing with their human based customer service, so I can't speak to that experience.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!
Reviews.Author: L. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: For someone who uses less than 100 minutes per month, $56 a month (Amazing how that $39.99 monthly fee blossoms to over $56 after taxes and fees!) for ATT's cheapest plan was too much. Now I spend $15 a month for 200 minutes and have had no problems. It also has the loudest ringer of any phone I've ever had, which is great when I have the stereo turned up in my truck! Great value for someone who just wants a basic phone to carry and doesn't use it much.ONE YEAR LATER....This phone is still going perfectly after all the banging around it gets in the console of my truck - awesome!

Reviews.Title: Terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: Albert B
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend any Net 10 phone if you think that you will ever need any type of customer service (eg activate phone, transfer phone number, buy minutes).  I have spent over 2 weeks on the phone every day with Net 10.  They have sent me 4 sim cards because every person I speak to inputs the incorrect info into their system.  I feel like I am speaking to high-school drop-outs who weren't able to get a job and hence are working as "managers" at Net 10.If you doubt this, do some internet searching for Net 10 customer service.  If you think you are getting a bargain for a cheap phone or phone plan, it's because you are purchasing something that has zero future value.

Reviews.Title: Unless you get it for around $10, you just got ripped off
Reviews.Author: Hao Zhang
Reviews.Content: This was actually my first phone. My dad bought it for me from Wal-Mart when I had to go to a conference in another city. This phone is about as basic as you can get these days, so it's good for kids under 10 years old that just need emergency contact. You MUST find this phone somewhere else for around $10, any higher would just be a ripoff (unless it comes with a bunch of accessories) because this phone doesn't do much.Let's look at the phone's physical form. The front has the small LCD screen and the keys. The left side has the micro USB port for charging (you cannot put anything on this phone). The top left corner of the phone has the hole for a lanyard/wrist strap. There is no speakerphone, so you must do all your listening from the earpiece on the front. Well, that's it really, there's not much stuff to gasp about for this phone other than the simplicity and the low price.The phone has basic features such as voice calling, contacts, text messaging, tools (alarm clock, calendar, notepad, calculator, tip calculator, world clock, stopwatch, unit converter), and a few mini games such as Sudoku and Reversi to keep you company if you are literally dying of boredom. You CANNOT put ANYTHING on this phone, so no custom ringtones, no apps, no games, no custom wallpapers, nothing. The phone has about 30 polyphonic ringtones preloaded, which sounds tinny and not the best. The call quality is surprisingly well, so if you want a phone JUST for calling, and maybe a few text messages here and there, this is a good phone. You can text with this phone using T9 prediction, so you don't have to keep pressing the same key to type a specific letter.This phone cannot browse the web, or do anything that uses data. It is a simple cellphone, so do not expect it to do anything more than calling and texting. The reception on this phone is pretty great, but not phenomenal. The battery has a capacity of 950mAh, which can last for about a week if you leave it on standby. If you need a phone that does a little more, go with something like the LG900G or other flip phones that NET10 offers. This phone is good for backup/spare/emergency purposes, which is great for parents with kids under 10 years old.

Reviews.Title: 5/5 for Phone, 3/5 for Company
Reviews.Author: Gar Polky
Reviews.Content: My 5 of 5 rating is for the Phone.  I'd give the company a 3 of 5.I was already a Net10 customer when I dropped my phone and half broke the screen.  I decided on this phone because it was the same manufacturer and was cheap.  There was a bit of a learning curve on re-adapting if you are used to a different phone, but it has all the basic extras.There is one problem, and I'm not sure if it's Net10 or the phone, but when I receive a text message from an iPhone that includes emoticons or special characters (°) then text message uses the iPhone character limit of 74 instead of the normal 160.  This is a bit annoying, but hasn't even cost me a full dollar yet and a heads up to friends can curtail this a bit.  Also the emoticons show up as question marks, so no, you don't even get to see them for the extra price.The company is a bit user unfriendly in my opinion.  When I tried to use their website to transfer my number and minutes, I was redirected back to my profile page with no further links and I had to call support to get the number transferred.  Took less than 5 minutes for the transfer to take effect though.  I also called support about the character limit problem and after several hours on the phone I was told my phone was charging me correctly per each incoming text.  After I did the math on the extra cost, I just decided to drop it.  And I feel like a sleaze for saying this, but I do wish their support wasn't in India.  Most of the support I've talked to have really heavy accents so I can't understand them, and if I try to get help through email, I'm given a number to call at.  Also, for a while the 300 minute 60 day cards were an endangered species in my county so I had to do some hunting to find them.But for $15 a month, you really can't complain that much.Also, despite the Tracfone symbol on the face, the phone WILL WORK with Net10.  Trust me, I was worried too.

Reviews.Title: It's a decent little phone.
Reviews.Author: S. D. Biddle
Reviews.Content: I just happened to be browsing on Amazon's site and saw the Net10 phone shown here; I have it, too. I am not crazy about Net10 customer service, but I hung with them when I reactivated my phone because I needed something affordable. This phone works really well..at work or in a store. Nothing fancy, just talk and text, of which I don't do much of. It has a nice loud alarm clock ring, a voice message noise & indicator, a few pretty scenes for the display and great battery life. I only paid $15.00 for it at Walmart. I used to be with Verizon, but their prices are too high. The 750 minutes for $25.oo is excellent...and I don't even use them all. This is a decent phone if you want something simple & affordable; but buy a new one. One time I bought a refurbished phone from Net10 and it didn't work outside  of my city.

Reviews.Title: Very bad tech support
Reviews.Author: Jean A. Smith "Jean A. Smith"
Reviews.Content: Customer service is awful. I asked to have my number changed and was mailed a new sim card. My phone is disabled and I have spoken to at least 6 different people in their support department. I cannot get a new number but I was asked for my credit card number from the last person I spoke to.The phone does not work now even though I have 189 minutes left from my original purchase.

Reviews.Title: Net10 has incredibly bad customer service!
Reviews.Author: Austin Gallaher
Reviews.Content: The phone worked OK except for the fact that I could not keep the phone activated. Net10 sent out a new SIM chip (twice), activated my phone and THEN deactivated the phone the next day! Incredibly bad customer service. Phone reps did not have a record of what had happened with my account on the previous calls. Each call was like starting over. And the phone connection to customer service was very bad. After trying multiple times to get my phone re-activated I just switched to a different company.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone for the price
Reviews.Author: avid reader
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for an older relative. Unfortunately I had to return it because the keys and keypad were too small for this individual.  The phone itself was a nice compact phone, came in new packaging, and was a good price.  The shipper was very fast and efficient and was very helpful in enabling me to return my purchase when I determined it was not going to work for us. I would definitely use this vendor again.

Reviews.Title: For the price, and ease of use...
Reviews.Author: C. Hintz "Om Gate"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for a guy who works 1/2 a day a week as a gardener/groundskeeper so he could find MORE odd-jobs and so he could be contacted to run errands as needed.  For simplicity and ease of use, it's hard to beat.  The phone isn't the best and the service may not be perfect but FOR THE PRICE, it's just great!

Reviews.Title: Like my prepaid LG phone
Reviews.Author: kay gafford
Reviews.Content: I've used one of these for years and really like the NET 10 service.  They are very generous when the customer has a problem and have give me several hundred minutes over the years when problems arose.I like the compact llittle phones, too

Reviews.Title: Great basic phone
Reviews.Author: Chickweed
Reviews.Content: It always works (except when it's run through the wash)(or in certain areas of Wisconsin where there's no support). It's simple, cheap, and does what needs to be done.

Reviews.Title: GREAT FOR MINIMAL CELL PHONE USERS
Reviews.Author: adsmammy "ADSMAMMY"
Reviews.Content: Great for my husband who is technically challenged and only uses the phone for emergencies.  We saved a bundle by using Net10 so that I was able to remove his other phone from our Verizon account.adsmammy 2/10/13

Reviews.Title: CUTE RELIABLE DURABLE PHONE
Reviews.Author: Michael D'orazio "Freakinout3"
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for 2 years, and it's durable, functions great, simple, easy, also I dropped it in the toilet and it didn't flood when I grabbed it. Never had a problem, although I got this phone through SAFELINK.com. I have a free plan.  Thank you Tracfone, and safelink...

Reviews.Title: Excellent Bare Bones Cell
Reviews.Author: SonicFireDust
Reviews.Content: I have had my LG 320G phone for over 2 years. It has survived being dropped many times by a toddler. This phone is extremely basic and is good for someone that doesnt care about looks or cool features. You can text on this phone, but i am not a texter so i hardly use that feature, I mainly just use it to make calls and sometimes calls to Mexico. I have never had any problems with droped calls or any other problems. I have never had to call customer service for support so i have no opinions on that matter. Anyway if your like me and just need a basic phone to call people then this phone is for you. Its only $25 a month for 750 minutes, i personally have never gotten up to 600 minutes, yes you do lose your unused minutes every 30 days but its still cheaper than buying a fancy phone with a data plan and a contract.

Reviews.Title: exellent
Reviews.Author: Sulkhan Tsabadze
Reviews.Content: everything was as described during choosing the item I am satisfied with my purchase. ifill need  that item anymore  I would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: MY device wasnt in good condition at all.
Reviews.Author: karlisha ballard
Reviews.Content: Because i only been using the device for 3 weeks and it stop working completely. I'm do dissatisfied wirh this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone.
Reviews.Author: B. Martinez
Reviews.Content: Very slim profile, extremely light, never had a problem with reception. Very durable. Battery lasted for days at a time. If you need a phone just for calls this is awesome. Texting is a pain with this, but then again, if you're a big texter you already know this isn't what you want.Unfortunately, the phone's amazing lightness almost worked against it, I left this phone somewhere and by the time I noticed it wasn't it my pocket it was a lost cause. Still, it was a really nice change from having to babysit a huge smartphone 24/7... I don't think I'll ever go back to that, I swear my old smartphone needed more maintenance than the average girlfriend.Would definitely buy one of these again though (torn between getting another of these, or reactivating a LG 300g which I already have).

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Shanda ottle
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my son and he loves it! I've had for awhile now and have had no problems with it !

Reviews.Title: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Pamela Lewis
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied with this product and my daughter likes it as well.  It suits her needs because  she is young and does not need anything fancy just yet.

Reviews.Title: Don't get this phone if you want to use the calendar or the alarm clock
Reviews.Author: Fluffinator
Reviews.Content: It's very confusing to enter appointments in the calendar and the appointment reminders have never worked for me.  The alarm clock doesn't have a repeat alarm feature, in case you would want the alarm clock to go off at the same time everyday.  If you want instructions for the calendar feature, forget about it.  At best you'll get the basic instructions for the phone, but nothing specific about such features.  Also--NO ONE is interested in creating an adaptor that would allow a person to at least use a headset with the phone.  And, there is nothing available in any stores that has any hopes of working with this model.  I've even contacted the manufacturer, which is LG.  Even LG begs off on this issue!  Their excuse is that none of the contractors who sell this make and model asks LG for the adaptor or a headset specifically for this phone.  Guess what the contractors say?  They say to contact the manufacturer!  While I'm not using this phone through Net10, that's really not the point here.  If you are in the situation where this is the only choice you have for a cell phone, you'll still get absolutely nowhere if you want any added features, should you even try to purchase such features on your own.As a pro, as a basic everyday phone, it is a good phone.  But, the supposed "added" features that come with it--DON'T WORK for the average person!To LG:  Not everyone wants or needs a Bluetooth just to have a headset device for their cellphone.  Some of us just want something that's actually affordable and doesn't have all the issues with it that I keep hearing people who have bluetooth devices talking about.  Enough already!  How about showing some respect and just making the adaptor available, so people actually have a choice?

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price.
Reviews.Author: Beverly Robinson
Reviews.Content: Nice phone, simple but gets the job done and the ease of getting service and adding minutes are the top reasons for keeping this phone.

Reviews.Title: My Best Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: Magali Rojas
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for years. Replaced the battery when communication came in broke, and wala, like new again. I have dropped it so many times and it still works. Customer service is good, you just need patience, so enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Great cell phone
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: I love this cell phone.  It's cheap, simple, slender and most of all, dependable.  It's worth the price and I highly recommend it.  I carry it in my front pocket and no one knows it.  I just bought two more as replacements.  They're great!

Reviews.Title: Second LG 320
Reviews.Author: Joey
Reviews.Content: This is my second LG 320 net ten phone in 4 years. I wanted the same product because I enjoy all the functions of this non flip, well constructed phone. I did think I would be able to use my old SIM card with my new phone but does not work that way. Was able to transfer minutes from old phone to new through customer support. Had to retype all my old phone numbers into new phone, but probably could avoid with sim card reader. The alarm is loud and wakes me every time. I also use the stop watch and calculator now and then. My nephews enjoy the 2 games on the phone as well. Many places around to purchase minutes. I do the 750 minutes/ 30 days for $25.00. Each text received and sent count as a minute.

Reviews.Title: nice basic phone
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: No more fumbling with flip phones.See who is calling before you answer.Use as a wake call in morning too!

Reviews.Title: Small Phone
Reviews.Author: Marquita
Reviews.Content: It turned out to be a little small for my Brother as a gift.  He uses it with his man fingers just fine.

Reviews.Title: my dad
Reviews.Author: cocoloveamazonj
Reviews.Content: my dad love it . He only use it for calls to me its just ok i love textin and internet . It came before the estimated delivery date and in the condition it pose to be in . I cant leave seller feedback

Reviews.Title: FALSE ADVERTIZING
Reviews.Author: L. Gowen "lois"
Reviews.Content: They say the phone is pay as you go, and make it sound as if you only pay when you use the phone.  It is pay as you go EVERY MONTH.  The phone is not prepaid.

Reviews.Title: mixed feelings
Reviews.Author: mzeina
Reviews.Content: i hate it, but i still give it 4 points, because it's so cheap. phone itself is a nightmare and hard to use, same is net 10 service provider. their website, online and customer services are a real mess. but it's excellent cheap disposable phone. if you loose or break it - no tears! and no one never ever wants to steal it!

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this phone
Reviews.Author: Ladybug
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone to replace another Net10 phone and was sorry I did. I admit I like the clam shell type phones best, but this one looked great. However, it kept dropping my calls ~ which is a headache when you've been on hold for a long time and have to start over! The ring tones are very good and loud for us older people, but I went back to the older Samsung phone. We have three of the same phone now. I love Net10, however customer service is from Guantemala! (I asked) and you can expect a long wait.

Reviews.Title: very bad customer service
Reviews.Author: strdesign
Reviews.Content: this phone is using net10 phone service and their customer support is terrible.  I do not recommend this phone and net10

Reviews.Title: Where are my minutes?
Reviews.Author: BigCharlie
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to come with 300 minutes but all I got was 10 minutes. I have been screwed yet again.
